page.title: 05Government
page.content: The block falls entirely within the civil and ecclesiastical parish of Cumnor. Until local government reorganisation in 1974, the area was in Berkshire and under the more immediate administration of the Abingdon Rural District Council. It is now in Oxfordshire and in the Vale of White Horse District. Cumnor Parish Council carries out the normal duties of a parish council eg. provision of street lighting, control of public open space. It meets monthly. It is consulted by the Vale of White Horse District Council which is the planning authority for the area, but cannot override decisions by that council.
